item.title: “Remembering the Stonewall Uprising – 55 Years Later” Exhibit on Display in Folsom Library
item.description: Date: Friday, June 21, 2024 5:00 PM - Sun , July 21, 2024 7:00 PM - On June 28, 1969, LGBTQ+ patrons at the Stonewall Inn in New York fought back against police harassment, helping to spawn the LGBTQIA+ rights movement. To honor this event, the LGBTQ+ Task Force is proud to present an exhibit on the history of the Stonewall Uprising on the main floor of Folsom Library, using archival sources from the Stonewall National Museum, Archives, and Library to show the Uprising’s important history.

item.title: ISSS, COG to Hold Paris Olympics Watch Party July 31
item.description: Date: Wednesday, July 31, 2024 3:00 PM - 6:00 PM - Whether you’re a sports enthusiast or just looking for a lively community event, join International Services for Students and Scholars (ISSS) and the Center of Gravity (COG) in DCC room 308 at their Paris Olympics Watch Party to witness the world’s best compete in the Summer Olympics! item.title: Windows Machines Blue Screen Error/Crash
item.description: DOTCIO is aware of an issue affecting some Windows machines due to a recent software update, in which the system will exhibit a blue screen error and crash. If you are experiencing this, please attempt a system reboot. If this does not resolve the issue, please contact the service desk for assistance at ext. 7777.

item.title: Summer Outdoor Program Series to Include River Tubing Trip
item.description: Date: Saturday, July 27, 2024 11:00 AM - 4:00 PM - Arch students are invited to join the Mueller Center’s river tubing trip, which will take place on the Battenkill River, located on the New York/Vermont border! This trip is limited to ten participants and registration is required; please look for information and registration on the Muller Center’s Instagram page, or contact Will Weinert if you have questions.

item.title: Computer Science Alumni Career Panel Scheduled for July 24
item.description: Date: Wednesday, July 24, 2024 7:00 PM - 8:00 PM - Students are invited to join this career panel, hosted by the School of Science Hub via WebEx. A fantastic opportunity to gain insights from distinguished alumni who have paved their way in various prominent tech companies, the event will cover topics such as career paths, industry insights, and tips for navigating the tech world.

item.title: Student Fall ’24/Spring ’25 Parking Permits Available as of August 1
item.description: Student parking permits for the Fall ’24/Spring ’25 semesters will be available for sale beginning Thursday, August 1. Please note that first-year students are not allowed to have a vehicle on campus, and all other students must register and have a valid permit before parking on campus. For additional information, please contact the Parking office by phone at (518) 276-6616 or via email.

item.title: Lally, NYSTEC Offering Day Trip to Griffiss Business and Technology Park
item.description: On Wednesday, July 24, students from all schools and majors are invited to attend a field trip to the Griffiss Business & Technology Park in Rome, NY. The trip will depart from the RPI Union loop at 8:00am and return to RPI by 4:30pm. Space is limited to 25 students, so visit the Handshake event page for full details and to register; email Dr. Kevin Fletcher with any dietary restrictions….
